intro: Lanthorus macrostachys, commonly known as the large-stemmed lanthorus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
